mozhi.serve.torch.handler¶

class mozhi.serve.torch.handler.hf_transformer_handler.HFNERHandler[source]¶

Bases: ts.torch_handler.base_handler.BaseHandler

A custom model handler implementation.

handle(data, context)[source]¶

Invoke by TorchServe for prediction request. Do pre-processing of data, prediction using model and postprocessing of prediciton output :param data: [{body: bytearray()}]Input data for prediction :param context: Initial context contains model server system properties. :return: prediction output

inference(model_input)[source]¶

Internal inference methods :param model_input: transformed model input data :return: list of inference output in NDArray

initialize(context)[source]¶

Initialize model. This will be called during model loading time :param context: Initial context contains model server system properties. :return:

postprocess(predictions, tokens)[source]¶

Return inference result. :param inference_output: list of inference output :return: list of predict results

preprocess(sequence_text)[source]¶

Transform raw input into model input data. :param batch: list of raw requests, should match batch size :return: list of preprocessed model input data

mozhi.serve.torch.handler.hf_transformer_handler.main(unserialized_mar_dir, sequence)[source]¶
Args:

unserialized_mar_dir: sequence:

Returns:

class mozhi.serve.torch.handler.transformer_ner.NERTorchServeHandler[source]¶

Bases: ts.torch_handler.base_handler.BaseHandler

align_out_label_with_original_sentence_tokens(ner_labels, example, feature)[source]¶
convert_example_to_feature(example)[source]¶
convert_sentence_to_example(sentence)[source]¶
convert_to_ents_dict(tokens, tags)[source]¶
inference(inputs)[source]¶

The Inference Function is used to make a prediction call on the given input request. The user needs to override the inference function to customize it.

Args:

data (Torch Tensor): A Torch Tensor is passed to make the Inference Request. The shape should match the model input shape.

Returns:

Torch Tensor : The Predicted Torch Tensor is returned in this function.

initialize(ctx)[source]¶
Initialize function loads the model.pt file and initialized the model object.

First try to load torchscript else load eager mode state_dict based model.

Args:

context (context): It is a JSON Object containing information pertaining to the model artifacts parameters.

Raises:

RuntimeError: Raises the Runtime error when the model.py is missing

postprocess(outputs)[source]¶

The post process function makes use of the output from the inference and converts into a Torchserve supported response output.

Args:

data (Torch Tensor): The torch tensor received from the prediction output of the model.

Returns:

List: The post process function returns a list of the predicted output.

preprocess(data)[source]¶

Preprocess function to convert the request input to a tensor(Torchserve supported format). The user needs to override to customize the pre-processing

Args :

data (list): List of the data from the request input.

Returns:

tensor: Returns the tensor data of the input

mozhi.serve.torch.handler.transformer_ner.get_labels(path)[source]¶
mozhi.serve.torch.handler.transformer_ner.handle(data, context)[source]¶
mozhi.serve.torch.handler.transformer_ner.list_classes_from_module(module, parent_class=None)[source]¶

Parse user defined module to get all model service classes in it. :param module: :param parent_class: :return: List of model service class definitions
